Interface_name: pipe based on proc_open in PHP
Instruction:
Task Description: Create a PHP class that provides a convenient way to execute shell commands with options for argument escaping, error capturing, and different execution methods (proc_open vs exec).

Class Description: The Command class encapsulates shell command execution functionality, allowing for flexible command building, execution, and result handling. It supports both proc_open and exec methods, with options for capturing stderr, escaping arguments, and configuring process execution environment.

Attributes:

escapeArgs: [bool] - Whether to escape arguments automatically (default true)
escapeCommand: [bool] - Whether to escape the command (default false)
useExec: [bool] - Whether to use exec() instead of proc_open() (default false)
captureStdErr: [bool] - Whether to capture stderr output (default true)
procCwd: [string|null] - Working directory for the process
procEnv: [array|null] - Environment variables for the process
procOptions: [array|null] - Additional options for proc_open
_command: [string] - The base command to execute
_args: [array] - Array of command arguments
_execCommand: [string|null] - The final constructed command string
_stdOut: [string] - Captured stdout output
_stdErr: [string] - Captured stderr output
_exitCode: [int|null] - Process exit code
_error: [string] - Last error message
_executed: [bool] - Whether command has been executed

Methods:

__construct: [mixed $options = null] -> [void] - Constructor that accepts either configuration array or command string
setCommand: [string $command] -> [self] - Sets the base command to execute
getCommand: [void] -> [string] - Gets the current base command
getExecCommand: [void] -> [string|false] - Gets the fully constructed command string
addArg: [string $key, mixed $value = null, bool $escape = null] -> [self] - Adds an argument to the command
execute: [void] -> [bool] - Executes the command and returns success status
getOutput: [void] -> [string] - Gets the stdout output
getError: [void] -> [string] - Gets the last error message
getStdErr: [void] -> [string] - Gets the stderr output
getExitCode: [void] -> [int|null] - Gets the process exit code
